meanings.sent1: The color blue is ubiquitous in the sky.
meanings.sent2: Technology has become ubiquitous in our daily lives.
meanings.sent3: The ubiquitous presence of squirrels in the park always makes me smile.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter was as ubiquitous as the sound of birds chirping in the morning.
meanings.sent5: The smell of fresh bread baking in the oven was as ubiquitous as a warm hug.

meanings.definition: Existing or being everywhere at the same time
meanings.sent1: The idea of time travel is as ubiquitous as the concept of space exploration.
meanings.sent2: In his dream, he felt a sense of ubiquitous presence surrounding him.
meanings.sent3: The ubiquitous nature of his jokes made everyone burst into laughter.
meanings.sent4: Her love for him was as ubiquitous as the stars in the night sky.
meanings.sent5: The feeling of excitement was ubiquitous among the crowd waiting for the concert to start.
